alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 29 at 2:29PM PDT until July 30 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY OVER THE EASTERN COLUMBIA RIVER GORGE AND PORTIONS OF THE LOWER COLUMBIA BASIN THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... .West winds will increase across the eastern Columbia River Gorge and the Lower Columbia Basin this afternoon and evening, and continue through Sunday evening. The afternoon relative humidity will be in the upper teens for many areas. The combination of hot and dry weather and gusty winds will result in red flag conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT SUNDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES OR641 AND WA691 SOUTH OF PROSSER AND THE TRI-CITIES... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 641 Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon and 691 Lower Columbia Basin. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent. * IMPACTS...Fires that develop will spread rapidly where strong winds occur. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
